data.title: master version cpp-tests runtime crash on ubuntu debug mode
data.body:
hi, just after building the latest commit: 3177f3431ecbedd5756317b72afc12a6ade45585 in ubuntu, I tested both my project and the cpp-tests in linux-debug mode, in both cases there is a segmentation fault: 

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x000000000185f1c2 in cocos2d::Node::insertChild (this=0x2f70540, child=0x2f708c0, z=0)
    at /home/cesar/Projects/cocos2d-x/cocos/2d/CCNode.cpp:1125
1125        ScriptEngineManager::getInstance()->getScriptEngine()->retainScriptObject(this, child);

I will try to collect more info on this, but would like to know if someone else has the same issue.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
关于RichText的使用问题
data.body:
我的版本是3.7.1   ，我用了官方的RichText来做富文本内容。   RichText没有发现换行的接口，即没有单独设置宽度的接口。
为了让他自动换行， 我用了ignoreContentAdaptWithSize(false) 和 setContentSize
但是你们在格式化内容的时候， if(!_ignoreSize) {  _elementRenderersContainer->setContentSize(_contentSize); }  (UIRichText.cpp 403行)。 这样一来我就没有办法得到真正的高度了。

而我只知道美术允许的宽度，但是不知道策划会给我什么内容，没办法确定高度。
在我现在的版本，我能通过不改源代码既能实现换行，又能知道实际的高度呢？

data.title: Fix drawing in incorrect app states on iOS
data.body:
1. Sometimes _layoutSubviews_ called from WebThread. Possibly it occurs due to some issues with banners.
2. Sometimes drawScene called too early, while app still is not Active (_applicationDidFinishLaunching_ was called, but _applicationDidBecomeActive_ wasn't).

P.S. Haven't find any reports when app crashed due to using opengl in inactive state after it successfully started. So it may be better to fix this issue only for _start_ flow, and remove _if_ condition inside _doCaller_.

data.title: Fixes #15049
iOS Simulator Build Linking Issues
data.body:
It appears that the libcocos2d iOS build has only the following valid architectures for Debug and Release:

`VALID_ARCHS = "arm64 armv7";`

This caused me linking headaches in XCode 7.2 as it refused to link against the Cocos libraries when doing a simulator build. This makes sense, because the simulator build is for an x86_64 architecture, not an ARM architecture like the actual device build. By removing the manually listed "valid architectures" and specifying not to only build the active architecture only the linker issues disappeared. I am submitting a pull request to correct this.

data.title: Bitmap font sizes are not loaded from binary .fnt files.
data.body:
This problem causes bitmap fonts based on .fnt files to not appear at all, and no error is thrown.
Fixes #15042.

data.title: Let ScrollView swallow touch events by default.
data.body: This is more intuitive. It's used by `UIWidget` too.

data.title: cpp v3.9 EventListenerAssetsManagerEx can not get callback in android 4.4.2
data.body:
If I click a button to update resources like the demo,it works for iOS and Android.
But if I call a function A in  update(float dt)  to start the downloading,the EventListenerAssetsManagerEx in A function could not be called in Android,it works for iOS only.
I tested in Android Device

data.title: Animate3D. node curve animation bugfix.
cc.textureCache.addImage() uses the wrong loader for images
data.body:
In the function cc.textureCache.addImage() there is the code
`var loadFunc = cc.loader._checkIsImageURL(url) ? cc.loader.load : cc.loader.loadImg;`
It checks if the url refers to an image and if it does it calls cc.loader.load. Seems like cc.loader.load and cc.loader.loadImg should be reversed.

data.title: cc.loader.loadImg() caches an empty image
data.body: With no option specified, the function assumes a cross origin image. If that request fails, then it retries the request assuming that the image is not cross origin. The problem is it already returned the empty image to the calling routine (cc._imgLoader.load()) which caches it using the url. When the loadImg() succeeds the second time around,  loadImg() caches the newly loaded image as well but using the realUrl (which appears to be a fully qualified url) instead of the url so the image was loaded but not cached in such a way that it can be accessed. Everything seems to access it through the url which is now an empty image and all of the images disappear.

data.title: Incorrect value returned from glview->getFrameSize() for iphone 6s
data.body:
Using the 3.10 release with a brand new project from the template.

As far as I'm aware glview->getFrameSize() should be returning 1334x750 on iPhone 6s, instead I get 1136x640.

If I try to render a sprite with anchor set as 0,0 (bottom left) at position 0,0 it renders off screen on iPhone 6s.

Works fine on simulator for older devices (pre 6).

The launch image appears to be there fine, I had to add the Icon-180.png to target but it didn't resolve any problems.

data.title: SpriteFrameCache: take pixelFormat into account if specified
data.body:
TexturePacker has nice feature - specify pixelFormat for atlas (RGBA8888, RGBA4444, etc). It may help to save used storage space and game memory. But currently it's not used in cocos2d-x and textures always loaded in currently specified DefaultPixelFormat (usually RGBA8888).

Though, currently info about pixelFormat also not exported by TexturePacker, but it can be added.

data.title: Sample project requires assets of non-compatible licenses
data.body:
For example the SpiderMonkey code uses the MPL/GPL/LGPL license instead of the MIT license that cocos2d-x is distributed under. Also the Spine code is under a custom personal only license that makes it unusable for distribution. See also the Kazmath, libjpeg, llvm, ogg-vorbis, Poly2Tri, and zlib licenses.
It is one thing for a developer to explicitly include the libraries they need. But the sample project doesn't need, as far as I can tell, any of these libraries.

Cocos2d-x version 3.10.

data.title: ScrollView children flickering on move (win32 fullscreen)
[JS] Changing scene leads to crash in release win32
Fixes USE_BULLET option
data.body:
The USE_BULLET option can affect both CC_USE_PHYSICS and CC_USE_3D_PHYSICS depending on whether the option is enabled or disabled, which will clobber the definitions that other options have already set such as USE_CHIPMUNK.

This fixes it to just affect CC_USE_3D_PHYSICS (which presumably was the intention all along).

data.title: Fix format string warnings
data.body:
When compiling with GCC 4.9 for Android NDK, it shows the warnings below:

```
cocos/audio/android/AudioEngine-inl.cpp:324:54: warning: format '%u' expects argument of type 'unsigned int', but argument 3 has type 'long unsigned int' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/AudioEngine-inl.cpp:344:54: warning: format '%u' expects argument of type 'unsigned int', but argument 3 has type 'long unsigned int' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/AudioEngine-inl.cpp:353:54: warning: format '%u' expects argument of type 'unsigned int', but argument 3 has type 'long unsigned int' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/AudioEngine-inl.cpp:362:54: warning: format '%u' expects argument of type 'unsigned int', but argument 3 has type 'long unsigned int' [-Wformat=]
```

This patch replaces `%u` (unsigned int) with `%lu` (long unsigned int) and fixes them.

data.title: could you get PageView EventListener CallBack in v3.10 c++ ?

I tested  PageView in v3.10 by c++, can not get EventListener when the page was turning.
I run the same code in v3.9 , it works.

data.title: Add Core Video uncompressed pixel format
data.body:
To capture uncompressed preview from the iOS camera, you have to set pixel format to `kCVPixelFormatType_32BGRA`.  See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15572893/capture-still-uiimage-without-compression-from-cmsamplebufferref.

This PR adds a pixel format that is RGBA8888 internally, sourced from BGRA8888 (i.e. `kCVPixelFormatType_32BGRA`

data.title: Fixed subtle documentation issues
data.body: Continued fixing spelling, typo, spacing + sentence flow issues.

data.title: Command line compile not working in 3.10
data.body:
With 3.10, Visual Studio 2015 and the command line tools, a newly created cocos project does not compile on the command line. Steps to reproduce are:

> C:\Users\winslave\Desktop>cocos new -l cpp compiletest
> 
> > Copy template into C:\Users\winslave\Desktop\compiletest
> > Copying cocos2d-x files...
> > Rename project name from 'HelloCpp' to 'compiletest'
> > Replace the project name from 'HelloCpp' to 'compiletest'
> > Replace the project package name from 'org.cocos2dx.hellocpp' to 'org.cocos2dx.compiletest'
> > Replace the Mac bundle id from 'org.cocos2dx.hellocpp' to 'org.cocos2dx.compiletest'
> > Replace the iOS bundle id from 'org.cocos2dx.hellocpp' to 'org.cocos2dx.compiletest'
> > C:\Users\winslave\Desktop>cd compiletest
> 
> C:\Users\winslave\Desktop\compiletest>cocos compile -p win32
> Building mode: debug
> Building...
> Required VS version : [2012, 2013]
> Can't find correct Visual Studio's path in the registry.

3.9 projects are working as expected. Discussion in the cocos2d-x forums is [here](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocos2d-x-3-10-required-vs-version-2012-2013/26413/8)

data.title: Renderer improvments: TriangleCommand and QuadCommand merged
data.body:
- more options for batching (faster)
- less flushing in between commands (faster)
- less renderer code (easier to maintain)
- less VBO/VAO (less memory)
- uses temporary buffer for faster rendering (more memory)
  - QuadCommand is just a subclass of TriangleCommand (simpler)
  - but statically it allocates indices internally (like any TriangleCommand) (more
    memory, but not that much)
- adds more tests for SpritePolygon
- adds test for batching Tri + Quad command
- and fixes some other bugs

Date:   Mon Feb 8 06:56:57 2016 -0800

Renderer improvments: TriangleCommand and QuadCommand merged

- more options for batching (faster)
- less flushing in between commands (faster)
- less renderer code (easier to maintain)
- less VBO/VAO (less memory)
- uses temporary buffer for faster rendering (more memory)

and fixes some other bugs
